intro: Werneria heteroloba, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic to many animals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, while the flowers are clustered in umbels and often have a yellow or orange hue. The plant is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for certain insects and birds.
